moves.1. d4 f5 2. c4 e6: another way, of handling the Dutch defense...
moves.3. Nf3 h6: the point is clear: square g5, is protected in an early stage; also making a quick g5 possible...
moves.4. Bf4: mostly preparing e3, and castling short...
moves.6. Bd3 g5 7. Bg3 Bg7 8. Nc3 Nc6: both players are postponing castling short: there is no returning from that...
moves.9. Qc2: as always: preparing e4, and finishing development: also making castling long possible...
moves.14... Nxf3 15. gxf3 Nxd4: forcing the White Queen to move: but where? after Qa4, Bd7, White is getting in trouble...
moves.16. Qd2: losing another tempo, but probably safest...
moves.16... Nxf3 17. Qe2 Nd4: White has to empty the cup...
moves.18. Qf1 f3: White has clearly made some bad decisions: not only, is Black a pawn ahead; but also introducing a multitude in threats...
moves.19. Rg1: forced: after Qg5+, g4 would fall...
moves.20. Kb1 a6: a safety measure, against Nb5: White has formed a battery, over the LSB diagonal...
moves.21. Qh3: searching for ways to trade Queens, with Qh5...
moves.22. Qh5 Bf6: Black is ready to trade Queens: at the cost of loss in tempo for White...
moves.23. Bg3: the wrong decision: this unpins the Black King, after Qxh5...
moves.23... Qxh5 24. gxh5 Kh7 25. Rgh1: preparing Bh4, to open the g-file...
moves.25... Bd7: preparing some counterplay: b5 comes in sight...
moves.26. Bh4 Bg5: like earlier: Black trades, on own conditions...
moves.27. Rdg1 Rfg8 28. Nd1: on the surface, a logical move: there might be progress, after Ne3; but White is abandoning two important squares: b5 and e2...
moves.29... Ne2: the price, for abandoning e2: the Rook has no place to go; if the Knight reaches f4, all is over for White: so it has to go...
moves.30. Bxe2 fxe2 31. Nd5: panicking: although Bxe3 is not nice, this will turn out worse...
moves.31... Bxh4 32. Rxg8: reacting too swiftly: but what too play else?
moves.32... Rxg8: realizing, what he has done, White needs to find a way out: Rxh4, Rg1+ is over...
moves.34... Rg1+ 35. Kc2 Bh4: just in time, to prevent Nf6+...

gameName: OTB training game: the Dutch defense (final)...
